ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and one leg is entwined with the other:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And anguish will be heaped upon anguish:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and calf is inter-twined with calf.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When legs are twisted around each other,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And one shin will curl up with the other shin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And one shank will be joined with another shank.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And affliction is combined with affliction;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and leg is intertwined with leg,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And agony is heaped on agony;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: when his legs are brought together [when affliction is combined with affliction];
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And one shank is entangled with the other shank.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and each shank clasps the other shank,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And one leg will be joined with another:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And leg will be joined with another leg (shrouded)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and when leg is intertwined with leg,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And leg is entwined with leg.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the leg is wound about the leg,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:29] and the shank is intertwined with the [other] shank, that is, one of his shanks [will be intertwined] with his other shank at the moment of death; or [it means] the distress of parting with this world is intertwined with the distress of the arrival of the Hereafter;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And agony is heaped on agony) and severity is heaped upon severity: the severity of the last day of the life of the world and that of the first day of the Hereafter; and it is also said this means: and the dead person's legs are twisted around each other;
